cA9Yw08h.title: A N , N ′-dioxide/Mg(OTf) 2 complex catalyzed enantioselective α-addition of isocyanides to alkylidene malonates
cA9Yw08h.abstract: A highly efficient catalytic asymmetric α-addition of isocyanides to alkylidene malonates was accomplished. The process was based on the utilization of a chiral N,N′-dioxide/MgII catalyst, delivering a variety of 2-alkyl-5-aminooxazoles in up to 99% yield and 96% ee under mild reaction conditions. Besides, a chiral imide and dipeptide could be easily obtained by ring-opening of the oxazole product, both of which are important structural motifs for many biologically active compounds. Based on the experimental investigations and previous work, a possible transition state model was proposed.

R5HJT99s.title: Catalytic asymmetric α-amination of β-keto esters and β-keto amides with a chiral N,N′-dioxide–copper(I) complex
R5HJT99s.abstract: The highly efficient asymmetric α-amination of β-keto esters and β-keto amides was realized by using a chiral N,N′-dioxide/Cu(I) complex. Under mild reaction conditions, a series of corresponding chiral α-amino dicarbonyl compounds were obtained in excellent yields (up to 98%) with excellent enantioselectivities (up to 95% ee).

PrDe9Piq.title: Chiral N,N′‐Dioxide‐Zinc(II) Complex‐Catalyzed Asymmetric Aza‐Friedel–Crafts Reaction of Isatin‐Derived Ketimines with Indoles
PrDe9Piq.abstract: A highly efficient chiral N,N′-dioxide-zinc(II) complex catalytic system has been developed for the enantioselective aza-Friedel–Crafts reaction of isatin-derived ketimines with indoles. A series of enantiomerically enriched 3-indolyl-3-aminooxindoles containing a tetrasubstituted stereocenter were obtained in up to 99% yield with up to 96% ee. Furthermore, control experiments provide a fundamental sight into the mechanism of the reaction.

GQdocCHP.title: Asymmetric synthesis of chromans via the Friedel–Crafts alkylation–hemiketalization catalysed by an N,N′-dioxide scandium(III) complex
GQdocCHP.abstract: An enantioselective tandem Friedel–Crafts alkylation–hemiketalization between electron-rich phenols and α,β-unsaturated ketoesters gave a direct approach to chiral 2,3-disubstituted chromans in the presence of a chiral N,N′-dioxide/Sc(OTf)3 complex. High enantioselectivities (up to 95% ee), high diastereoselectivities (up to 14 : 1) and high yields (up to 97%) were obtained for a broad range of substrates under mild reaction conditions.

jYJsi305.title: Chiral N,N′-dioxide/Co(II)-promoted asymmetric 1,3-dipolar cycloaddition of nitrones with methyleneindolinones
jYJsi305.abstract: A chiral N,N′-dioxide/Co(BF4)2·6H2O complex catalytic system has been developed to efficiently catalyze the asymmetric 1,3-dipolar cycloaddition of nitrones with methyleneindolinones. The corresponding chiral multisubstituted spiroisoxazolidines with three contiguous quaternary–tertiary stereocenters were obtained in moderate to high yields with excellent dr and ee values (up to 97% yield, u003e19 : 1 dr and 98% ee).

Mg7EtrD6.title: Chiral N,N′-dioxide/Sc(OTf)3 complex-catalyzed asymmetric dearomatization of β-naphthols
Mg7EtrD6.abstract: An efficient N,N′-dioxide–scandium(III) complex catalytic system has been developed for the asymmetric dearomatization of β-naphthols through conjugate addition to alkynones. A variety of Z-predominated β-naphthalenone compounds were obtained in moderate to high yields with excellent enantioselectivities (up to 98% ee). Moreover, a possible transition state was proposed to explain the origin of the stereoselectivity.

Iww0r0U6.title: Asymmetric ring-opening of cyclopropyl ketones with β-naphthols catalyzed by a chiral N,N′-dioxide–scandium(III) complex
Iww0r0U6.abstract: A catalytic asymmetric ring-opening reaction of cyclopropyl ketones with β-naphthols has been accomplished. In the presence of a chiral N,N′-dioxide/scandium(III) complex, a series of aromatic or vinyl substituted cyclopropyl ketones reacted with 2-naphthols, providing efficient access to chiral β-naphthol derivatives in good yields (up to 99%) with good enantioselectivities (up to 97% ee). Notably, using the mixture of 2-naphthol substrates did not affect the efficiency of this catalytic system.

TE9edAHu.abstract: The catalytic desymmetric direct vinylogous Michael/cyclization domino reaction of 2-(4-substituted-cyclohexylidene) malononitriles with N-protected methyleneindolinones was realized by a combination of a chiral N,N′-dioxide/Mg(II) complex and an organic base. JaO8x2VC.title: RNA Interference Silence HER2 Expression in Salivary Gland Mucoepidermoid Carcinoma Cell Line Mc3
JaO8x2VC.abstract: Objective To silence HER2 expression in salivary gland mucoepidermoid carcinoma cell line Mc3 using RNA interference.Methods HER2-siRNA was transfected into Mc3 cell by Lipofectamine.RT-PCR and immunohistochemistry were employed to detect HER2 expression change in Mc3 after RNA interference.Results Compared with non-transfected control,Lipofectamine control,and siRNA control,RT-PCR test announced that HER2 mRNA expression was degraded in HER2-siRNA transfected cells,and immunohistochemistry test announced HER2 protein expression was also degraded just as HER2 mRNA.Conclusion RNA interference can stably silence HER2 gene expression in salivary gland mucoepidermoid carcinoma cell at both mRNA and protein levels.This indicates great prospect as a novel approach of gene therapy for salivary gland mucoepidermoid carcinoma targeting HER2 gene.

kC9wcYdb.title: The effect of electrical stimulation of nucleus tractus solitarius on cardiac nociception and its spinal cord mechanism in rat]
kC9wcYdb.abstract: Examine the effect of electrical stimulation of nucleus tractus solitaries (NTS) on cardiac-somatic motor reflex (CMR) that induced by intrapericardial administration of capsaicin to clarify the spinal cord mechanism of NTS involved in cardiac nociception in rat.SD rats were randomly divided into electrical stimulation, control, yohimbine and naloxone group and treated with elecetrical stimulation NTS alone, or with intrathecal injection of vehicle, saline, norepinephrine a2 receptors antagonist (yohimbine), opioid receptor antagonist (naloxone) respectively.Electrical stimulation of NTS (10, 20, 50 MA), the CMR response deceased in an intensity-dependent manner (P<0.05); intrathecal injection of vehicle, saline had no effect on the inhibition effect of electrical stimulation (P>0.05); intrathecal injection of yohimbine (20 microg, 50 microg) or naloxone (50 microg, 100 microg), reversed the inhibition effect of electrical stimulation (P<0.05); intrathecal injection of low dose of naloxone, the inhibition effect of electrical stimulation was potentiated.Electrical stimulation of NTS has inhibition effect on cardiac nociception, norepinephrine alpha2 receptors and opioid receptor in spinal cord involved in this descending inhibition, low dose of naloxone has synergetic effect with descending inhibition.
kC9wcYdb.venue: Sichuan da xue xue bao. Yi xue ban = Journal of Sichuan University. Medical science edition

KuPCBK1F.title: Comparison of two methods of section making and detection of apoptosis method on human scalp hair follicle in vitro
KuPCBK1F.abstract: Objective To compare two methods of section making and to detect the apoptosis on human hair follicle(HF) in vitro.Methods The paraffin section and frozen section methods were used.The TUNEL[fluorescence staining and 3,3′-Diaminobenzidine(DAB) staining] was used to investigate the apoptotic cells of different parts when the hair follicles were uncultured and cultured on 5~(th) day.Results The process of making frozen section was more simple and feasible on single hair follicle.The apoptotic index of outer root sheath(ORS),lower part of hair bulb(HB),the dermal sheath(DS) and dermal papilla(DP) of every groups had no difference((P>0.05).) Conclusion The method of frozen section was more feasible on the section making of single hair follicle.The TUNEL with fluorescence staining and DAB staining was suitable for the detection of apoptotic status of hair follicle.

u1pukCZc.title: Descending inhibitory effect of lateral reticular nucleus treated with electrical stimulation on cardiosomatic motor reflex in rats and its mechanism
u1pukCZc.abstract: Objective: To study the descending inhibitory effect of the lateral reticular nucleus (LRN) treated with electrical stimulation on the cardiosomatic motor reflex (CMR) induced by intrapericardial capsaicin (IC) in rats and its mechanism. Methods: 22 male SD rats were randomly divided into electrical stimulation group (n = 7), electrical stimulation plus 3 g·L -1 yohimbine group(n = 5), electrical stimulation plus 5 g·L -1 yohimbine group (n = 5) and electrical stimulation plus vehicle group(n = 5). The electromyogram (EMG) changes of dorsal spinotrapezius muscle of CMR induced by IC of rats were observed following intervention with treatment factors in various groups. Results: Compared with control group, EMG could be inhibited by electrical stimulation of 10, 20 and 30 μA in LRN, the inhibitory effect was increased with the increasing of the electrical stimulation intensity accompanied or not accompanied with changes of blood pressure; the EMG reduced to 51.41%, 21.11% and 1.43% of the control (P<0.001); Compared with electrical stimulation (10 μA) group, intrathecal injection of adrenergic α2 receptor antagonist yohimbine (3 and 5 g·L -1) reversed the inhibitory effects of LRN stimulation on CMR, the EMG responses increased from 41.34% to 72.40% and 78.73%, respectively (P<0.01). Conclusion: Electrical stimulation of LRN can produce descending inhibition on CMR and α2-adrenoceptors at spinal cord level may be involved in the inhibition.

yG8gq6Ve.title: Changes of myocardial nociception with VR1 and CGRP expressions in diabetic rats
yG8gq6Ve.abstract: Objective: To study the changes of cardiac nociception and the expressions of vanilloid receptor subtype1 (VR1) and calcitonin gene-related peptide (CGRP) in the myocardium of diabetic rats for the purpose of finding the relationship of cardiac nociception with VR1 and CGRP expressions. Methods: The diabetic model of Sprague Dawle (SD) rats was established with streptozotocin (STZ). Electrophysiology was used to observe the changes of cardiac nociception with intrapericardial capsaicin evoked electromyography (EMG) responses in the spinotrapezius muscle as an index; VR1 and CGRP expressions were detected by immunohistochemical technique. Results: Injection of CAP into intrapericardial sac could evoke SPT discharge. Compared with those of the controls, the latency of EMG evoked by intrapericardial capsaicin was prolonged [(9.8 ± 4.1) s vs. (2.1 ± 0.4) s], the average discharge rate was decreased [(30.3 ± 5.9) imp/s vs. (120.0 ± 20.5) imp/s, P < 0.05], and the expressions of VR1 and CGRP were significantly decreased in STZ-treated rats (P < 0.001). Conclusion: Cardiac nociception is decreased in diabetic rats, which may be due to the lower expressions of VR1 and CGRP in the myocardium.

Z2F3bwJM.title: Lateral reticular nucleus modulates the cardiosomatic reflex evoked by intrapericardial capsaicin in the rat.
Z2F3bwJM.abstract: The current study examined the role of the lateral reticular nucleus (LRN) in modulating the cardiosomatic reflex (CSR) induced by intrapericardial capsaicin in the anesthetized rat. Intrapericardial capsaicin was administered, and the CSR was monitored via electromyogram responses of the dorsal spinotrapezius muscle. Electrical stimulation of the LRN (10, 20 and 30 μA) depressed the CSR induced by intrapericardial capsaicin in an intensity-dependent manner. Microinjection of glutamate (4, 10, 20 and 40 nmol, in 0.2 μL) into the LRN replicated the effects of electrical stimulation. Furthermore, bilateral transections of the dorsolateral funiculus (DLF) decreased the LRN electrical stimulation-induced inhibition of the electromyogram responses. Intrathecal administration of the α2 -adrenergic receptor antagonist yohimbine or the serotonergic receptor antagonist methysergide significantly attenuated the LRN electrical stimulation-induced inhibition of the electromyogram responses. However, intrathecal application of the opioid receptor antagonist naloxone had no effect on the LRN electrical stimulation-induced inhibition. These results suggest that the LRN-DLF-spinal cord pathway is involved in descending inhibition of the CSR, and spinal α2 -adrenergic and serotonergic receptors participate in this descending inhibition.

YANDAjw5.title: Apoptotic study on the effect of fluorine and selenium on the human hair follicle in vitro]
YANDAjw5.abstract: The aim of this study was to observe the human hair follicle apoptosis status affected by fluorine and the antagonism effect by selenium in vitro.The single hair follicles were separated and cultured, then they were added in different concentrations of sodium fluoride and sodium selenite. Chosen the appropriate concentrations, they were divided into 7 groups. The TUNEL was used to investigate the apoptotic cells of different parts. The morphous of hair follicles was observed consecutively and electron microscope was used.We found that in 1 mmol/L and 10 mmol/L sodium fluoride groups, when the human hair follicles in vitro were cultured on the 5th day, the apoptotic cells of outer root sheath (ORS), dermal sheath and hair papilla, hair bulb were obviously increased. But 0.01 mmol/L sodium selenite weakened the toxicity of 1 mmol/L sodium fluoride at the outer root sheath and hair bulb (P < 0.05).Different concentrations of sodium fluoride had different effect on the growth of human hair follicle in vitro which were cultured on 5th day. Sodium fluoride of certain concentration could accelerate the apoptosis of human hair follicle in vitro. Sodium selenite of certain concentration could act antagonism to the toxicity of sodium fluoride.

a2Xstqb5.title: C-erbB2 and PTEN expressions in salivary gland adenoid cystic carcinoma cell line SACC-83
a2Xstqb5.abstract: Objective To detect the expressions of C-erbB2 and PTEN in salivary gland adenoid cystic carcinoma cell line SACC-83,and study the correlation of them.Methods After we cultured SACC-83 cell,RT-PCR and immunohistochemistry were employed to detect the expressions of C-erbB2 and PTEN in SACC-83 cell and normal salivary gland cell.Results The expression of C-erbB2 in SACC-83 cell was conspicuously higher than that in normal salivary gland cell.But the expressions of PTEN in SACC-83 cell and normal salivary gland cell were not different.Conclusion Our data demonstrated that C-erbB2 gene was overexpressed in salivary gland adenoid cystic carcinoma cell line SACC-83,and it was related to salivary gland adenoid cystic carcinoma genesis.

Oobrz9Be.title: Modulatory effect of neurokinin-1 and non-N-methyl-D-aspartate receptors on cardiosomatic reflex in rat spinal cord
Oobrz9Be.abstract: To investigate the role of neurokinin-1 (NK1) receptor and non-N-methyl-D-aspartate (non-NMDA) receptor in modulating the cardiosomatic reflex in the spinal cord of rat.The effects of intrathecal injection of NK1 receptor agonist Sar-SP and antagonist CP-96345 and non-NMDA receptor agonist NMDA and antagonist 6, 7-dinitro-1,4-dihydro-quinoxaline-2,3-dione (DNQX) on the cardiosomatic reflex were observed in rats. The changes of the cardiosomatic reflex were monitored by observing the electromyogram (EMG) responses of the dorsal spinotrapezius muscle to intrapericardial bradykinin (BK) injection.Intrathecal injection of Sar-SP significantly facilitated EMG responses to intrapericardial BK injection (P&lt;0.05), which was completely blocked by intrathecal injection of NK1 antagonist CP-96345. Similarly, intrathecal injection of NMDA obviously facilitated the EMG responses (P&lt;0.05), which was partially reversed by intrathecal injection of non-NMDA receptor antagonist DNQX. Intrathecal injection of Sar-SP along with NMDA significantly increased EMG as compared with single administration of Sar-SP or NMDA (P&lt;0.05).The spinal cord levels of NK1 receptor and non-NMDA receptor are involved in the modulation of the cardiosomatic reflex in rats.

rkGpFbX8.title: Modulation of NMDA receptor to rat cardiacsomatic motor reflex induced by intrapericardial bradykinin in spinal cord
rkGpFbX8.abstract: Objective: To observe the effects of the intrathecal injection of N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA) receptor agonist NMDA and antagonist MK801 on the cardiacsomatic motor reflex (CMR) induced by intrapericardial bradykinin (BK), and explore the role of Glu receptor NMDA subunit in nociceptive information transmission of the heart in the spinal cord. Methods: 26 male SD rats were randomly divided into BK group(n = 8), BK + NMDA group(n = 6), BK + MK801 group(n = 6), and BK + MK801 + NMDA group(n = 6). CMR was induced by intrapericardial BK, and the effects of intrathecal injection of drug in various groups on CMR were observed. The changes of CMR were monitored via electromyogram (EMG) responses of dorsal spinotrapezius muscle to intrapericardial BK. Results: There were no significant differences among EMG induced by intrapericardial BK, four times at 40 min intervals. Compared with control, the EMG was increased from 100% of control to (149.86 ± 8.54) % by intrathecal injection of NMDA, there was significant difference of EMG between before and after intrathecal injection of NMDA (P<0.05). However, the EMG was decreased from 100% of control to (96.22 ± 2.31) % by intrathecal injection of MK801, there was no statistically significant difference (P>0.05). The EMG was increased from 100% of control to (103.09 ± 4.13) % by intrathecal combinative injection of MK801 and NMDA, there was no significant difference of EMG between before and after intrathecal combined injection of MK801 and NMDA (P>0.05). Conclusion: CMR induced by intrapericardial BK has reliable repeatability and the spinal cord level of NMDA receptor involves in the modulation of CMR.

OYRKvMtY.title: The role of NMDA and NK1 receptors in cardiac nociceptive information transmissions in the spinal cords of rats]
OYRKvMtY.abstract: To determine the effects of NMDA and NK1 receptor agonist and antagonist on the EMG and the synaptic mechanism of nociceptive information transmissions in the spinal cords.Male SD rats were randomly divided into seven groups, with intrathecal injection of the following chemicals respectively: control group (10 microL saline), NMDA group (0.147 microg/10 pL NMDA), MK801 group (6.8 microg/10 microL MK801), MK801+NMDA group (6.8 microg/10 pL MK801+0. 147 microg/10 pL NMDA), Sar-SP group (1.4 pg/10 microL Sar-SP), CP-96345 group (5 microg/10 pL CP-96345), and CP-96345+Sar-SP group (1.4 micro/10 microL Sar-SP+5 microg/10 microL CP-96345). A cardiac pain model in rats through intrapericardial injection of capsaicin was established. Intrapericardial injection of capsaicin was given to the rats 10 min after intrathecal injection of the tested chemicals. The spinotrapezius electromyography (EMG) activities as an index of cardiac-somatic motor reflex were recorded simultaneously.Compared with the pre-test controls (100%), saline did not make a significant change to the capsaicin-evoked EMG response (96. 9% +/- 12. 5%, P>0. 05); NMDA agonist increased the capsaicin-evoked EMG response (185. 2% +/- 24. 4%) significantly (P<0. 05); neither MK801 nor a combined administration of MK801 and NMDA made a significant change to the capsaicin-evoked EMG response (106. 6% +/- 10. 2%, P> 0.05); Sar-SP increased the capsaicin-evoked EMG response (145. 6% 10. 1%) significantly (P<0. 05); whereas neither CP-96345 nor a combined administration of CP-96345 and Sar-SP made a significant change to the capsaicin-evoked EMG response (102. 2% +/- 8. 4%, P>0.05).NMDA and NK1 receptors may have participated in the transmissions of cardiac nociception information in the spinal cords of rats.
OYRKvMtY.venue: Sichuan da xue xue bao. Yi xue ban = Journal of Sichuan University. Medical science edition

Xp6hPxoW.title: Analysis of physiology exam results of clinical medical students of seven-year program in Xi'an Jiaotong University
Xp6hPxoW.abstract: Objective:To analyze the results of physiology exam of 568 clinical medical students of seven-year program in grades 2002,2003 and 2004 in College of Medicine,Xi'an Jiaotong University.Methods:Combination of quantitative and qualitative analyses,with the qualitative analysis mainly.Results:1.The distribution of the score of physiology in every grade is reasonable;and the degree of difficulty and discrimination is proper.2.There is a significant difference between the score of male and female students.Suggestion:1.Setting up a normal system for score analysis and teaching appraisal.2.Using modern teaching methods to improve the students' initiative and enthusiasm.

0MfyGzH4.title: Simultaneous determination of hydroquinone and catechol by SWNTs/GC electrode
0MfyGzH4.abstract: A single-walled carbon nanotubes modified glassy carbon(SWNTs/GC) electrode was prepared.The electrochemical determination of two dihydroxybenzenes(hydroquinone and catechol) at the SWNTs/GC electrode was investigated by cyclic voltammetry.The results showed that the SWNTs/GC electrode exhibited strong recognition and electrocatalytical ability toward two isomers.The oxidation peak potential difference between hydroquinone and catechol was 106 mV,which indicated that the two isomers could be identified entirely at the SWNTs/GC electrode.Based on their voltammetric behavior,a method was proposed for the simultaneous determination of two dihydroxybenzenes at the SWNTs/GC electrode.Under the optimum conditions,the calibration curves showed good linear relationship for catechol with the range of 3.0×10-6~8.0×10-5 mol·L-1,and its detection limit was 1.0×10-6 mol·L-1.The oxidation peak current was linearly proportional to the concentration of hydroquinone with the range of 8.0×10-6~1.0×10-4 mol·L-1,and its detection limit was 2.67×10-6 mol·L-1.

SYjdC0uy.title: Study of the Conformational Changes of HSA as It Interact with Phenothiazine
SYjdC0uy.abstract: The conformational changes of HSA were investigated as it interacted with phenothiazine(PTZ).The fluorescence quenching between HSA and PTZ was also studied in this work.The results indicated that PTZ quenched the fluorescence of HSA by static process and formed complex with HSA.Results also indicated that PTZ did not induce the conformational changes of HSA as they interacted.So PTZ can not change the protein HSA physiological functions when it is used as a drug in curing peoples'illness.Hence this work has great importance in pharmacology and clinical medicine.

7DecptSU.title: Determination of protein concentration using fluorescence spectral method based on the interaction of bovine serum albumin with folic acid
7DecptSU.abstract: Fluorescence spectroscopy and fluorescence intensity change of the interaction of different concentration of bovine serum albumin with the same concentration have been studied.Experimental results reveal that with the protein concentration gradually increasing the fluorescence intensity,the protein concentration and fluorescence intensity had a evident linear relationship. This paper also discussed the melamine influence,and its possibility to increase protein concentration.Accordingly,an efficient fluorescence-based new method for measuring protein concentration will be established.The limit of detection is 5 mg·L-1,the linear range is 3.77×10-2~827 mg·L-1,the correlation coefficient is 0.998 9,and the recovery is 93.7%~106.2%.

1IjF10MT.title: Synthesis and Characterization of Anionic Phospholipid DSPG Bilayer Protected Au Nanoparticles
1IjF10MT.abstract: The DSPG bilayer-protected Au nanoparticles were prepared by one-step method and characterized by TEM,UV-Vis spectroscopy,XPS and IR spectroscopy.The results showed that as-prepared Au nanoparticles with 3～5 nm diameters have good water solubility and stability.

NTghXTw9.title: Roles of Guidance Teachers in Guiding Academic Dissertation of Undergraduate in Chemistry
NTghXTw9.abstract: Based on the practice in guiding the undergraduate thesis,the responsibilities for teachers,the selection and investigation of research topic,how to write research papers had been primarily studied,and some experience for teachers on how to play a role in guiding undergraduate students' thesis in chemistry was also expressed.
NTghXTw9.venue: Journal of Henan Institute of Education(Natural Science Edition)

tVeGkVAz.title: Prefractionation Method to Separate Proteomic Proteins into Multigroups by One-step Extraction
tVeGkVAz.abstract: For the first time,an aqueous two-phase system( ATPS) composed of n-propanol,NaCl and water was applied in prefractionating proteomic proteins. In this work,ethanol,n-propanol and several commonly used inorganic salts were attempted to develop the ATPS. The ATPS composed of n-propanol,NaCl and water was developed finally. Subsequently,the effects of pH,salt concentration,n-propanol volume and protein concentration on the ATPS' separation effectiveness for proteins were studied. Protein samples were prefractionated by the ATPS and then analyzed by gel electrophoresis. The results proved that the prefractionation method could separate proteomic proteins into three groups by one-step extraction,and there was no need for separating target proteins from the phase-forming reagents prior to gel electrophoresis analysis. Simplicity,rapidity and low cost are the highlight attractiveness of the prefractionation method. It also has advantages of biocompability,potential for continuous operation,no requirement for sophisticated instrumentations and being easy or no need for separating the target proteins from phase-forming reagents prior to electrophoresis analysis. The prefractionation method has great significance in proteomics and methodology.

SnGaCkjo.title: Study on catalyzing transesterification of soybean oil with methanol for biodiesel using supported MgO on SBA-15
SnGaCkjo.abstract: In this paper,supported MgO catalyst was prepared by in-situ method with SBA-15 as the carrier.The catalytic activity of MgO-SBA-15 as-synthesis was studied based on the transesterification reaction of soybean oil with methanol for biodiesel under the reaction conditions of 9∶ 1 methanol to oil,3% catalyst(mass ratio of catalyst of oil),65 ℃ of temperature and 3 h reaction time.The study results proved that in-situ synthesized MgO-SBA-15 showed higher catalytic ability with 78% of biodiesel yield.

Zjo5tPWA.title: Study of the Interaction between Divalent Ions and Lipid Bilayer Using Au Nanoparticles as Probe
Zjo5tPWA.abstract: The dihexadecyl phosphate(DHP)bilayer-protected Au nanopartilces were prepared by a simple one-step method.The interactions between divalent ions(Ca2+ and Mg2+)and DHP bilayers supported in the surface of Au nanoparticles were investigated with Au nanoparticles as probes by using UV-vis spectroscopy.The experimental results showed that Ca2+ and Mg2+ could induce DHP bilayer aggregate,fuse even collapse and the effect of Ca2+ was stronger than that of Mg2+.

4BOugPn6.title: Direct Electrochemistry of Horseradish Peroxidase at Glassy Carbon Electrode Modified with Titanate Nanotubes
4BOugPn6.abstract: Direct electrochemistry of horseradish peroxidase at glassy carbon electrode modified with titanate nanotubes had been demonstrated by cyclic voltammetry.A pair of redox peaks attributed to the direct redox reaction of horseradish peroxidase in the phosphate buffer solution was observed.UV-VIS spectra showed that the conformation of horseradish peroxidase almost did not change in the presence of titanate nanotubes.It means that titanate nanotubes have good biocompatibility for horseradish peroxidase.In addition,it was proved by electrochemical method that the modified electrode could catalyze the reduction of H2O2 efficiently.

ldNCmYvx.title: The Studies on the Interaction of Human Serum Albumin with Folic Acid by the Fluorescence Spectroscopic Methods
ldNCmYvx.abstract: The interaction of bovine serum albumin with folic acid was studied based on the fluorescence spectroscopic methods. The results indicated that human serum albumin interacted with folic acid as they coexisted,and they formed into protein-drug complex by the static quenching of human serum albumin by folic acid. The results also showed that the human serum albumin interacted with folic acid by hydrophobic association,and there was one binding-site for folic acid in the molecule of human serum albumin as they interacted.

GIJhdOAw.title: Analysis on the Conformational Changes of BSA Interacted with Indo-1 Using Fluorescence Spectroscopic Methods
GIJhdOAw.abstract: The interaction of bovine serum albumin(BSA) with the fluorescent probe molecule,Indo-1 was proved by the fluorescent spectroscopic and Absorbance spectroscopic methods as they coexisted.Using the synchronous fluorescence spectroscopic method,the conformational changes of BSA were investigated as it interacted with Indo-1.The effect of solution acidity on the interaction of BSA with Indo-1 was also studied.The results indicated that Indo-1 did not induce the conformational changes of BSA as they interacted.Thus Indo-1 can be used as fluorescence probe molecule in studying the interaction of proteins,which have similar structure with BSA,with other ligands by fluorescence spectroscopic methods.

8Z3p5OOH.title: Robust model predictive control of singular systems with delayed-state and parameter uncertainty based on state observer
8Z3p5OOH.abstract: The problem of observer-based robust predictive control for the singular systems with uncertainties and time-delay is presented. The design method of robust predictive observer-based controller is proposed. By constructing the Lyapunov function with the error terms, and with the method of LMIs, the infinite time domain "min-max" optimization problems are converted into convex programming problems. Then the sufficient conditions for the existence of this control are derived. The robust stability of the closed-loop singular systems is guaranteed by the initial feasible solutions of the optimization problems. The regular and the impulse-free of singular systems are also hold. A simulation example illustrates the effectiveness of this method.

V5iwDLrI.title: Output-feedback stabilization of high-order stochastic nonlinear systems with more general growth conditions
V5iwDLrI.abstract: This paper investigates the output-feedback stabilization problem for a class of high-order stochastic nonlinear systems with more general growth conditions. Based on the backstepping design method and homogeneous domination technique, the closed-loop system can be proved to be globally asymptotically stable in probability. The efficiency of the output-feedback controller is demonstrated by a simulation example. © 2011 Chinese Assoc of Automati.
V5iwDLrI.venue: Proceedings of the 30th Chinese Control Conference, CCC 2011

O65p0HiQ.title: Guaranteed Cost Control with Pole Constrains for Delta Operator Uncertain Linear Systems
O65p0HiQ.abstract: The problem of guaranteed cost controller with circular pole constrains for delta-operator linear systems with norm-bounded parameter uncertainty is focused on.At first,the closed poles are located within a specific circular region and a necessary and sufficient condition for the existence of guaranteed cost controllers is derived in terms of linear matrix inequalities.It is shown that two conditions are equivalent to the solvability problem of the linear matrix inequalities,and its solutions provide a parameterized representation of guaranteed cost controller.Secondly,the designed problem of the guaranteed cost controller with circular pole constrains is given by solving a corresponding convex optimization problem.At last,an example is given to illustrate the effectiveness of the results.

BPVgDnHM.title: Stable Generalized Predictive Control for Systems with Uncertainties
BPVgDnHM.abstract: A stable generalized predictive control algorithm is presented by using Min-Max optimization.Based on the internal model control structure,the disturbances and uncertainties are separated from the system.The linear equations of terminal constraints are obtained by Min-Max optimization.The solution of the linear equations is presented using Moore-Penrose inverse and the control law is obtained.The simulation result shows that the proposed method has a good stability.

muobjXei.title: Stable Generalized Predictive Control for Uncertain Systems
muobjXei.abstract: To a kind of linear discrete-time control systems with bounded uncertainties,a new stable generalized predictive control is presented by using the Min-Max optimization method.Basing on the internal model control structure,disturbances and uncertainties are separated from the system.The linear equation systems of terminal constraints are obtained by Min-Max optimization.The solution of the linear equation systems is obtained using Moore-Penrose inverse and the control law is proposed.The simulation result shows that the proposed method has a good stability.

SQISoGex.title: Robust model predictive control for continuous uncertain systems with state delay
SQISoGex.abstract:
This paper is concerned with robust model predictive control for linear continuous uncertain systems with state delay and
 control constraints. A piecewise constant control sequence is calculated by minimizing the upper-bound of the infinite horizon
 quadratic cost function. At each sampling time, the sufficient conditions for the existence of the model predictive control
 are derived, and expressed as a set of linear matrix inequalities. The robust stability of the closed-loop systems is guaranteed
 by the proposed design method. A numerical example is given to illustrate the main results.
SQISoGex.venue: Journal of Control Theory and Applications

tbtwbmZp.title: Direct constrained robust predictive control based on state observer
tbtwbmZp.abstract: For multi-packet described linear discrete uncertain system,when the state can not be measured,an direct method of constrained robust model predictive control algorithm is proposed.The observer and controller are designed comprehensively,and observed state is used to structure performance index directly.Through solving the min-max optimization problem with infinite horizon performance cost,the system optimal state feedback control law is obtained.When the constrains of input/state is met,the parameter-dependent Lyapunov function are introduced to ensure the closedloop system stability.Simulation examples show the effectiveness of the proposed approach.

VYoIsiyF.title: Output feedback predictive control for networked control system with time-varying delay
VYoIsiyF.abstract: In this paper, an output feedback predictive control algorithm for networked control systems with time-varying time-delay is presented. Based on the Lyapunov method, the existence of the controller is given in terms of the nonlinear form. The cone complementary linearization idea is then employed to convert the controller design into a nonlinear programming problem with linear matrix inequalities constraints. Finally, the condition for the stability of closed-loop systems is given. The effectiveness of the proposed design methodology is verified by a numerical example.

TLb1pFYe.title: Robust H_∞ Observer for a Class of Uncertain Singular Systems with Time Delay
TLb1pFYe.abstract: The robust H∞ observer problem is considered for a class of uncertain singular systems with delay.The sufficient condition for the existence of robust H∞ observer with time delay is given in terms of linear matrix inequalities;and the robust H∞ observer is designed based on a LMI constraint.It is guaranteed that the filtering error system is regular,stable and impulse-free within a prescribed H∞ performance level.Numerical example validate the feasibility of the design method.

r0Y9JDCt.title: Robust model predictive control of uncertain singular systems Based on the state observer
r0Y9JDCt.abstract: The problem of robust model predictive control is studied for the singular systems with norm-bounded uncertainties when the states of controlled systems are unmeasurable. A new method is proposed by the observer-based feedback control. At each sampling time, the infinite time domain "min-max" optimization problems are converted into convex optimization problems. By constructing the Lyapunov function with the error term, the sufficient conditions for the existence of robust model predictive control are derived and expressed as linear matrix inequalities. When the obtained feedback control satisfying some conditions, the robust stability of the closed-loop singular systems is guaranteed by the proposed design method, and the regular and the impulse-free of singular systems are also maintained. A simulation example illustrates the efficiency of this method. ©2008 IEEE.
r0Y9JDCt.venue: Proceedings of the IEEE International Conference on Industrial Technology

8PKsKtU4.title: Based H∞ performance robust predictive control for uncertainty multi-rate system
8PKsKtU4.abstract: This paper proposes a robust predictive control algorithm based on H∞ performance for uncertainty multi-rate control system. The upper bound $ of H∞ performance target for the multi-rate closed-loop system is derived by using linear matrix inequality approach, and the condition of the robust stability for the closed-loop system is obtained. The simulation results show the effectiveness of the proposed algorithm.

ysk1EVSO.title: Robust predictive control via output feedback for Markov jump system
ysk1EVSO.abstract: For quasi-linear parameter varying Markov jump system, when the state can not be measured, a manner of output feedback robust model predictive control was proposed for the system with polytopic uncertainty and bounded disturbance. Through solving the min-max optimization problem with infinite horizon performance cost, the output feedback law of closed-loop system was obtained. With the circumstance of input and output, the stochastic stability of the closed-loop system was guaranteed by utilizing the quadratic boundedness. At last, a numerical example was given to illustrate the effectiveness of the controller.
ysk1EVSO.venue: Zhongnan Daxue Xuebao (Ziran Kexue Ban)/Journal of Central South University (Science and Technology)

eGVGuejx.title: Infinite horizon generalized predictive control in delta-domain
eGVGuejx.abstract: The major weakness of GPC is the lack of general stability guarantees. Instead of SIORHC/CRHPC and SGPC for general stability guarantee, we adopt infinite costing horizon which is known to lead stability but it has its own implementation difficulties. A practical means of implementing delta-GPC with infinite costing horizon with inequality constraints is presented in this paper. Simulations are given to demonstrate its advantage.

L6JE7lNX.title: LQR control scheme for active vehicle suspension systems based on modal decomposition
L6JE7lNX.abstract: A new control scheme combining the classical LQR control with modal decomposition method is presented for an active vehicle suspension system. Modal decomposition is proposed to optimize the weighted modal matrix, which gives each modal decomposition components with different weights according to their different importance. The LQR control scheme based on modal decomposition method is designed to improve anti-disturbance performance for the vehicle suspension system. Finally, simulations for a two-degree-of-freedom quarter-car model with an active suspension are given to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed approach compared with the passive suspension.

aMKRPsFa.title: Dual-rate DMC Algorithm with Predictive States
aMKRPsFa.abstract: Using lifting technology,this paper extends the state-space DMC algorithm to a practical case of multirate systems with fast input control and slow output sampling.Performance of such a dual-rate DMC algorithm is campared with that of single-rate systems and the reason for its advantages is established.Simulation results verify that this dual rate predictive control algorithm can follow setpoints without overstrikes,and quicker system response can be abtained.

authors.name: ZHANG Feng-juan
authors.org: School of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Yantai ,China

authors.name: LIU Xiao-hua
authors.org: School of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Yantai ,China

ttEEqaYG.title: Adaptive Control for Delay Parameters in Singular Time-delay Systems
ttEEqaYG.abstract: A state feedback controller is designed for singular systems with time-delay.Based on Lyapunov-Krasovskii stability theory and linear matrix inequalities,designing state feedback controller with memory to make corresponding closed-loop system stable when constant of time-delay is known accurately;By solving corresponding LMIS,an adaptive controller is designed to satisfy design requirements and make system with time-delay stabilization when constant of time-delay isn't known accurately.Finally,a numerical example is given to illustrate the effectiveness of the proposed method.

authors.name: LI Sheng-tao
authors.org: College of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Yantai ,China

authors.name: LIU Xiao-hua
authors.org: College of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Yantai ,China

ESujN1R2.title: Delay-dependent robust predictive control for polytopic uncertain systems
ESujN1R2.abstract: A linear state transformation is introduced into continuous-time polytopic uncertain time-delay systems. The delay-dependent robust predictive controllers are designed by using linear matrix inequality approach. A delay-dependent sufficient condition for the stability of the system is derived via Lyapunov function. The simulation example shows the effectiveness of the proposed method.

vPybFRMi.title: Infinite horizon continuous-time generalized predictive control
vPybFRMi.abstract: The cost function with infinite horizon is imported into the continuous-time generalized predictive control. By importing the new end-point equality constraints, the optimal problem which has a cost function with infinite horizon can be transformed into a solvable quadric programming problem. The condition for guaranting the stability of the closed-loop system of continuous-time generalized predictive control is given according to the monotonicity of the receding-horizon cost. Simulation result shows the effectiveness of the algorithm.

6STupi4w.title: Robust model predictive control for continuous-time polytopic uncertain systems
6STupi4w.abstract: The synthesis method of robust model predictive control is presented for continuous-time systems with polytopic uncertainties.A piecewise constant control sequence is obtained by minimizing the worst-case linear quadratic objective function.At each sampling time,the sufficient conditions on the existence of the state feedback control are given and expressed as a set of linear matrix inequalities.Closed-loop stability and feasibility retention over the time are proved.Simulation results show the effectiveness of the control algorithm.

authors.name: LIU Xiao-hua
authors.org: School of Mathematics and Information,Ludong Univ.,Yantai ,China

authors.name: HAN Chun-yan
authors.org: School of Control Science and Engineering,Shandong Univ.,Jinan , China

8D8cXvN7.title: Analysis and design of dual-rate inferential control systems
8D8cXvN7.abstract: For dual-rate sample system with different output sampling and input updating a model-based inferential control scheme is proposed, the stability robustness in the presence of model-plant mismatch (MPM) is analysed. Comparing such an inferential controller with the corresponding fast single-rate controller, the former is advantageous in stability robustness of the closed-loop system. A robust algorithm with extremely low computational requirements has been led, combining with a global uncertainty description and an uncertainty band-updating procedure. The simulation example shows the efficiency of the algorithms.

authors.name: Xiao-hua Liu
authors.org: School of Mathematics and Information, Ludong University, Yantai, 264025, China.

authors.name: Jie Luo
authors.org: School of Mathematics and Information, Ludong University, Yantai, 264025, China

nYmjCLJv.title: Observer-based robust model predictive control of singular systems
nYmjCLJv.abstract: The problem of robust model predictive control is studied for the singular systems with norm-bounded uncertainties when the states of controlled systems are unmeasurable. By using of the LMIs, the infinite time domain ldquomin-maxrdquo optimization problems are converted into convex optimization problems. By constructing the Lyapunov function with the error term, the sufficient conditions for the existence of robust model predictive control are derived and expressed as linear matrix inequalities. The robust stability of the closed-loop singular systems is guaranteed by the proposed design method, and the singular systems are regular and the impulse-free. A simulation example illustrates the efficiency of this method.

X1Jh903U.title: Continuous-time Generalized Predictive Weighted Control Algorithm for Non-minimum Phase Processes
X1Jh903U.abstract: The continuous-time generalized predictive control(CGPC) law has some robustness for the special case when λ and Nu is respectively equal to 0 and Ny-ρ,even the system will be unstable for non-minimum phase processes under the limited condition.A new weighted predictive control algorithm is introduced and the dynamic characteristic of the closed-loop set-point response is irrelative to B(s).An illustrative example shows the performance of the application of the results presented.

authors.name: LIU Hao
authors.org: 1.School of Information,Qingdao Vocation and Technical College,Qingdao ,China

iU1fW0wX.title: A STABLE CONTINUOUS-TIME GENERALIZED PREDICTIVE CONTROL
iU1fW0wX.abstract: The closed-loop stability of the continuous-time generalized predictive control is considered,by using the infinite horizon control.The 1-norm cost function with infinite horizon is imported.By inflicting the new end-point equality constraints,an upper bound of the cost function with infinite horizon is given,and the unsolvable optimal problem can be transformed into a solvable optimal problem.Then the quasi-infinite horizon approach which can guarantee the closed loop stability of generalized predictive control is presented.Simulation result shows the validity of the proposed control.

authors.name: LIU Fang
authors.org: School of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Shandong

authors.name: LIU Xiaohua
authors.org: School of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Shandong

iU1fW0wX.venue: Journal of Systems Science and Mathematical Sciences

QmqXdjF4.title: Delay-dependent Robust H_∞Control for Uncertain Systems with Interval Time-varying Delay
QmqXdjF4.abstract: The problem of robust H_∞control for uncertain system with interval time-varying state-delay is considered.Based on Lyapunov-Krasovskii stability theory and linear matrix inequalities,using free matrix technique,a delay-dependent sufficient condition is derived, making the resultant closed-loop systems asymptoticlly stable and satisfying a prescribed H_∞cost constraint.And a design method of state feedback robust H_∞control law is given. Finally,a numerical example is given to illustrate the effectiveness of the proposed method.

authors.name: LI Sheng-tao
authors.org: College of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Yantai ,China

authors.name: LIU Xiao-hua
authors.org: College of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Yantai ,China

sNPDxykA.title: Robust model predictive control for stochastic singular systems with polytopic uncertainty based on state observer
sNPDxykA.abstract: The problem of robust predictive control is investigated for stochastic singular systems with polytopic uncertainty, and a design method of robust predictive controller based on off-line state observer is proposed. By constructing the Lyapunov function with the error terms, using multidimensional Itô formula and LMI methods, the "min-max" stochastic programming problem is converted into the solvability problem of a group of LMIs, and then the expression and sufficient conditions for the existence of the control law are given. It is proved that the stochastic admissible property of the closed-loop singular systems is guaranteed by the initial feasible solutions of the optimization problem. A simulation example illustrates the effectiveness of the proposed method.

pAGxqQ8X.title: RMPC Fault Tolerant Control of Constrained Multi-sensor Linear Systems
pAGxqQ8X.abstract: In this paper,for a class of constrained multi-sensor linear fault system,we propose a fault-tolerant control scheme based on robust predictive control strategy.Firstly,the observer is designed for multi-sensor linear systems,then,invariant set sequences is designed off-line,and the time-varying state estimation error exists in the corresponding invariant set sequences.A new fault detection method is proposed based on the invariant set theory.Lastly,we design fault-tolerant controller for fault system based on robust predictive control strategy,and the closed-loop system robust stability is proved.The simulation results show that the method is feasible.

authors.name: GAO Xue-wei
authors.org: School of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Yantai ,China

authors.name: LIU Xiao-hua
authors.org: School of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Yantai ,China

Lp28NoOH.title: Short-term Load Forecasting Based on a Combination of an Improved Global Harmony Search Algorithm and LSSVM
Lp28NoOH.abstract: To overcome the drawback of the global harmony search(GHS) algorithm,the improved global harmony search algorithm(IGHS) is proposed.By means of broadening the searching area in the GHS algorithm and introducing fine-tuning variable affected by the harmony memory,the search efficiency is improved.Then,the proposed IGHS algorithm is applied to the optimization of parameters in LSSVM short-term load forecasting.The load data and meteorological data are utilized to test the forecasting model,and the simulation results show that the proposed method can improve the predicting accuracy.

authors.name: JIANG Xin
authors.org: School of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Yantai ,China

yAJzSufg.title: Robust Model Predictive Control for Networked Control System with Input Constraint
yAJzSufg.abstract: A robust model predictive control algorithm for polytopic uncertain networked control systems with random time-delay and input constraint is presented.Considersing the Min-Max infinite horizon cost function while the random network delay is assumpted as Markov chain,the mode-dependent state feedback controller is proposed,according to linear matrix inequalities.The condition for the feasibility and robust stochastic stability of the algorithm is given based on Lyapunov function method.The simulation shows the effectiveness of the proposed algorithm.

authors.name: LI Jian
authors.org: School of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Yantai ,China

authors.name: LIU Xiao-hua
authors.org: School of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Yantai ,China

T2vNMbaN.title: A Generalized LMI-Based Approach to the Global Asymptotic Stability of Cellular Neural Networks with Delay
T2vNMbaN.abstract: The global exponential stability problem of Cellular neural networks with delays is investigated in this paper.A new stability condition is present based on Lyapunov Krasovskii method,which is dependent on the size of delays.The results are given in the form of LMI,and the admitted upper bound of the delay can be obtained easily.The time delay independent results can be got,which include some results in the former literature.Finally,a numerical example is given to illustrate the effectiveness of the main results.

authors.name: WANG Lu-ping
authors.org: Mathematics & Information Science College,Shandong Institute of Business and Technology,Yantai ,China

T2vNMbaN.venue: Journal of Henan Normal University(Natural Science)

3fEEk8jw.title: Guaranteed cost filtering for a class of Delta-operator uncertain time delay systems
3fEEk8jw.abstract: For a class of Delta-operator polytypic uncertain linear systems with time delay, the problem of guaranteed cost filtering is investigated. The sufficient conditions for the existence of filter and filter design methods are established by using LMI approach. The guaranteed cost filter guarantees asymptotic stability for filtering error dynamics and minimizing performance measures. The proposed method brings previous related conclusions of continuous and discrete-time systems into the unified Delta-operator form. A numerical simulation shows the feasibility of the developed algorithms.

49S21VHh.title: Direct constrained multi-rate robust predictive control based on state observer
49S21VHh.abstract: For multi-packet described linear discrete uncertain multi-rate system, when the state can not be measured, a direct method of constrained robust model predictive control algorithm is proposed. The observer and controller are comprehensive designed, the structure performance index is built directly using observed state. Through solving the min-max optimization problem with infinite horizon performance cost, the system optimal state feedback control law is obtained. When the constrains of input/state is meet, the parameter-dependent Lyapunov function is introduced to ensure the closed-loop system stability. The effectiveness of the proposed approach is verified by simulation examples.
49S21VHh.venue: Zhongnan Daxue Xuebao (Ziran Kexue Ban)/Journal of Central South University (Science and Technology)

5GdOekpg.title: Short-term Load Forecasting Based on LSSVM and Deterministic Annealing Clustering
5GdOekpg.abstract: A short-term load forecasting method based on LSSVM and deterministic annealing clustering algorithm is proposed. All kinds of factors affecting load data are considered to form load samples. Load samples are classified using deterministic annealing algorithm,then fed into the least square support vector machines. The load data and meteorological data of a electrical company in 2007 is utilized to test the forecasting model. The simulation result shows that the proposed method can improve the predicting accuracy.

authors.name: GAO Rong

zpjxdJ1P.title: An Improved Robust Generalized Predictive Control Algorithm
zpjxdJ1P.abstract: A new robust predictive controller synthesis algorithm is proposed for a class of singular systems with polytopic uncertainty.Linear matrix inequalities method with multi-Lyapunov function is adopted.That is to say,a single-Lyapunov function is in each vertex of the polyhedron,which improves the single-Lyapunov function algorithm and comes up with a less conservative robust model predictive control algorithm.At the same time,the initial feasible solution of the optimization problem guarantees the asymptotic stability of the system.A simulation example shows the effectiveness of the method.

y91iurrr.title: Robust L_2-L_∞ Filtering for a Class of Uncertain Continuous-Time Systems with Regional Pole Constraint
y91iurrr.abstract: The problem of robust L_2-L_∞ filtering with pole constraints was considered for a class linear continuous-time system.The system is assumed to have parameter uncertainties belonging to a polytope.The sufficient condition for the existence of robust L_2-L_∞ filtering is given in terms of linear matrix inequalities;and the robust full-order and reduced-order L_2-L_∞ filterings are designed based on LMI constraints.It is guaranteed that the filtering error system is asymptotically stable within prespecified pole placement constraints and given L_2-L_∞ attenuation level.A numerical example is given to illustrate the design methods.

authors.name: ZHOU Li-na
authors.org: School of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Yantai ,China

y91iurrr.venue: Journal of Qingdao University(Engineering & Technology Edition)

6zjCOKqv.title: Short term load forecasting using wavelet transform and SVM based on similar-days
6zjCOKqv.abstract: For the short-term electric power load with uncertain influence factors, a novel approach is proposed by combining the wavelet transform (WT) and support vector machine (SVM). From the signal analysis point of view, load can also be considered as a linear combination of different frequencies. By the WT, the different load sequence components are projects to the different scales. Based on the maximum and minimum loads of the approximate part, the similar coefficients are given. The support vector machine is used to forecast the maximum and minimum load of the forecasting day. The short term load forecasting is forecasted by summing the predicted approximate part and the weighted detail parts. The numerical simulation results show this approach is encouraging.
6zjCOKqv.venue: Diangong Jishu Xuebao/Transactions of China Electrotechnical Society

NQKxLwIC.title: Short Term Load Forecasting Using Wavelet Transform and SVM Based on Similar-Days
NQKxLwIC.abstract: For the short-term electric power load with uncertain influence factors, a novel approach is proposed by combining the wavelet transform (WT) and support vector machine (SVM). From the signal analysis point of view, load can also be considered as a linear combination of different frequencies. By the WT, the different load sequence components are projects to the different scales. Based on the maximum and minimum loads of the approximate part, the similar coefficients are given. The support vector machine is used to forecast the maximum and minimum load of the forecasting day. The short term load forecasting is forecasted by summing the predicted approximate part and the weighted detail parts. The numerical simulation results show this approach is encouraging.

dZuIHM6H.title: The Offline Robust Predictive Control of Uncertain Singular Systems with Input Constraints
dZuIHM6H.abstract: For polytopic uncertain singular systems with input constraints,an offline robust predictive control algorithm used by LMI and ellipsoidal invariant sets is given.The part of the online calculating is translated into that of offline design by this algorithm in the condition of input constraints.So the calculation of online optimization problems is reduced by the offline design in this paper.A numerical simulation results show the feasibility and effectiveness of the algorithm.

dg8eTvLK.title: Constrained Continuous-time Generalized Predictive Control
dg8eTvLK.abstract: The constrained continuous-time generalized predictive control is discussed,by using the 1-norm cost function with infinite horizon which is different from the cost function with finite horizon.An upper bound of the cost function with infinite horizon is confirmed by inflicting the end-point equality constraints on it.The unsolvable optimal problem with constraints is transformed into a solvable optimal problem.Finally the quasi-infinite horizon approach is presented to guarantee the closed loop stability of constrained continuous-time generalized predictive control.Simulation result shows the effectiveness of the algorithm.

authors.name: LIU Fang
authors.org: College of Health Management,Binzhou Medical University,Yantai ,China

authors.org: School of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Yantai ,China

HqOtVj3I.title: Stochastic Model Predictive Control for Markov Jump Systems Based on Probabilistic Tubes
HqOtVj3I.abstract: An stochastic model predictive control strategy for Markov jump systems with stochastic disturbances,considering probabilistic constraints of state,is proposed.By adopting the technology of Tube,probabilistic constraints are converted into recursively feasible probabilistic tubes.The controller based on recursively feasible probabilistic tubes can ensure closed loop system stochastic stability.The simulation results demonstrate the effectiveness of the method.

authors.name: GE Tian-tian
authors.org: School of Mathematics and Statistics Science,Ludong University,Yantai ,China

authors.name: LIU Xiao-hua
authors.org: School of Mathematics and Statistics Science,Ludong University,Yantai ,China

4dB6TYfK.title: Robust model predictive control for uncertain singular systems via dynamic output feedback
4dB6TYfK.abstract: The problem of robust output feedback model predictive control is studied for the singular systems with norm-bounded uncertainties when the states of controlled systems are unmeasurable. Based on the idea of variable transformation and LMI methods, the infinite time domain "min-max" optimization problems are converted into linear programming problems. A piecewise continuous output feedback control law is obtained and the sufficient conditions for the existence of this control law are given. It is proved that the robust stability of the closed-loop singular systems is guaranteed by the initial feasible solutions of the optimization problems, and the regular and the impulse-free of singular systems are also held. A simulation example shows the effectiveness of this method.

GfJwXlsx.title: Based H_∞ performance robust predictive control for uncertainty multirate system
GfJwXlsx.abstract: This paper proposes a robust predictive control algorithm based on H∞ performance for uncertainty multi-rate control system. The upper bound γ of H∞ performance target for the multi-rate closed-loop system is derived by using linear matrix inequality approach, and the condition of the robust stability for the closed-loop system is obtained. The simulation results show the effectiveness of the proposed algorithm.

3xdRB0aA.title: Continuous-time Generalized Predictive Control with Model Uncertainty
3xdRB0aA.abstract: The cost function with infinite horizon is introduced in order to guarantee the closed-loop stability of the generalized predictive control with model uncertainty.The system parameters are estimated by using least-squares estimator,and the control input is calculated based on the estimated system model at each sampling instant.The optimal problem which has a cost function with infinite horizon can be transformed into a solvable quadric programming one,if the new end-point equality constraints is appended.The stable condition which can guarantee closed-loop system of continuous-time generalized predictive control is given according to the proof of the monotonicity of the receding-horizon cost.The simulation results testify the corretness and effectineness of the algorithm.

authors.name: LIU Fang

XoQpLBKf.title: Robust memory state feedback non-fragile H_∞ control of an uncertain neutral stochastic time-delay systems
XoQpLBKf.abstract: The problem of robust and non-fragile stabilization and robust non-fragile H∞ control for a class of neutral stochastic time-delay systems with norm-bounded parameter uncertainties was studied.The sufficient conditions ensuring the closed-loop system mean-square asymptotically stable were established With the additive and multiplicative gain uncertainty in the controller,based on the Lyapunov functional,Ito formula and Schur theory.Furthermore,the sufficient conditions were obtained for the solvability of robust non-fragile H∞ control of the uncertain system.The memory state feedback non-fragile H∞ controllers of the stochastic neutral delay system were designed by solving linear matrix inequality.The numerical example was provided to illustrate the effectiveness of the proposed design method.

authors.name: ZHOU Li-na
authors.org: Mathematics & Information Science College,Shandong Institute of Business and Technology,Yantai ,China

authors.name: LIU Xiao-hua

MRhAKv2t.title: State-Feedback Predictive Controller Based On Estimator for Non-uniformly Sampled System
MRhAKv2t.abstract: This paper proposed a state-feedback predictive control algorithm for the non-uniformly sampled system,in which the control signals are updated in different instants.Control signals are lifted so that control signals and output signals can have same period.A computationally effective non-uniformly sampled system estimated states scheme are presented,Which are calculated only at sampling instants.At each sampling time,the sufficient conditions on the existence of the state feedback control are given and expressed as a set of linear matrix inequalities.Simulation results show the effectiveness of t1he control algorithms.

authors.name: DENG Hong-xia
authors.org: Department of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Yantai Shandong ,China

authors.name: LIU Xiao-hua
authors.org: Department of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Yantai Shandong ,China

W19Oo1cy.title: The Mathematical Model of the Invigilation in Final Examination
W19Oo1cy.abstract: The final examination schedule is an important and complex task in educational affair administration.To the actuality that schedule is so difficult and workload is greatness, the large-scale linear integer programming model is established.The automatic schedule for the invigilator and examination time along with examination place is accomplished.Applying to the practical schedule in school of mathematics and information of Ludong University,the favorable effect is brought.

authors.name: XU Xin
authors.org: School of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Yantai ,China

authors.name: ZHAI Jin-gang
authors.org: School of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Yantai ,China

19Sys1ZE.title: Robust Model Predictive Control of Singular System Based on H_∞ Approach
19Sys1ZE.abstract: By linear matrix inequality,robust model predictive control problem of singular system is studied based on H∞ approach.If the upper bound of performance index is given,the problem of solving H∞ performance index is converted to LMI optimization problem.At each sample time,the state feedback control law can be obtained by solving linear matrix inequalities.It is proved that the asymptotical stability of the closed systems is guaranteed by the initial feasible solutions of the optimization problem.

authors.name: BI Ying-Bin
authors.org: The Bureau of Land and Resources,Rongcheng ,China

NeGPWN8s.title: Model Predictive Control Based on Dynamic Compensation for Rectangular Descriptor Systems
NeGPWN8s.abstract: The finite-horizon model predictive control by dynamic compensation for rectangular descriptor system is considered.A dynamic compensator with a proper dynamic order is given such that the closed-loop system is regular,impulse-free,stable.A terminal weight matrix is introduced in the performance to ensure the stability,and matrix inequlity and Lyapunov equation is utilized in order to solve the optimal problem.The proposed Lyapunov equation is transformed into a bilinear matrix inequality,then a path-following algorithm is used to minimize the performance index.At last,a numerical example is given to illustrate the effectiveness of the controller.

authors.name: SONG Xiu-hong
authors.org: School of Mathematics and Statistics Science,Ludong University,Yantai ,China

authors.name: LIU Xiao-hua
authors.org: School of Mathematics and Statistics Science,Ludong University,Yantai ,China

yQOGRF1g.title: Min-max Robust Predictive Control for Uncertainty Multi-rate System
yQOGRF1g.abstract: The robust predictive control problem of uncertainty multi-rate control system is investigated.A min-max robust predictive control algorithm based on the Lyapunov function is presented.Linear matrix inequalities(LMI) is used in this algorithm to develop the upper bound γ of H∞ performance index,which converted the optimization problem to minimize this upper bound γ,and proved that the closed-loop system is robust stability.The simulation results verify the effectiveness of the algorithm.

authors.name: MA Chun-yan
authors.org: School of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Yantai ,China

authors.name: LIU Xiao-hua
authors.org: School of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Yantai ,China

wDQiaMOu.title: Robust Predictive Control for Uncertain Continuous-time System Based on Output Feedback
wDQiaMOu.abstract: An output feedback based robust predictive control algorithm for linear continuous-time systems with norm-bounded parameter uncertainties is presented by linear matrix inequality formulation.Based on the idea of variable transformation,the infinite time domain "min-max" optimization problems are converted into linear programming problems,a piecewise continuous output feedback control law is obtained and the sufficient conditions for the exis-(tence) of this control law are given.It is proved that the robust stability of the closed-loop systems is guaranteed by the initial feasible solutions of the optimization problems.A simulation example illustrates the efficiency of this method.

authors.name: HAN Chun-yan
authors.org: School of Mathematics ane Information,Ludong University,Yantai,China;School of Control Science and Engineering,Shandong University,Jinan,China

authors.name: LIU Xiao-hua
authors.org: School of Mathematics ane Information,Ludong University,Yantai,China

ZsHnR3Hb.title: A Comprehensive Multi-rate Predictive Controller Based on Networked Model
ZsHnR3Hb.abstract: A class of multi-rate predictive controller based on networked model is proposed to the problems of network delay and package dropout of networked control systems(NCS),based on the combination of predictive controller and network delay compensator.The network delay of sensor-controller is compensated by predictive controller and the network delay of controller-acter is compensated by network delay compensator.Computer simulations show that the algorithm compensates the network delay,optimizes the performance requirement of NCS,and improves the network efficiency.The proposed method can guarantee the stability of the closed-loop NCS.

4J8eYXNp.title: A direct robust predictive control algorithm for multi-rate systems
4J8eYXNp.abstract: In view of the actual system exists interference, when the update rate of input and output is not the same as the sampling rate, a direct robust predictive control algorithm is presented. Combined robust predictive control and system parameter estimation algorithm, directly according to the input/output data of the system, using min-max thought, the robust predictive control algorithm for multi-rate systems is derived. The results are illustrated with examples. © 2011 Chinese Assoc of Automati.
4J8eYXNp.venue: Proceedings of the 30th Chinese Control Conference, CCC 2011

DymTidrL.title: State-feedback Predictive Controller Based on State Estimator for Non-uniformly Sampled System
DymTidrL.abstract: A state-feedback predictive control algorithm based on state-estimator for the non-uniformly sampled system,in which the control signals are updated in different instants,is proposed.Input control signals and output signals can have same period by lifting control signals,and then a computationally effective non-uniformly sampled system estimated states scheme is presented.The sufficient conditions on the existence of the state feedback control are given and expressed as a set of linear matrix inequalities,and optimization problems under quadratic performance index are solved here.Simulation results show the effectiveness of the control algorithms.

authors.name: DENG Hong-xia
authors.org: School of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Yantai ,China

authors.name: LIU Xiao-hua
authors.org: School of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Yantai ,China

9HAw4V8j.title: Robust predictive control of uncertain singular systems with both state and input delays
9HAw4V8j.abstract: The problem of robust predictive control is investigated for uncertain singular systems with both state and input delays.The design method of robust predictive controller is proposed;the approximate solutions of optimal problems for infinite time interval and with quadratic performance index are calculated by means of Lyapunov stable theory and linear matrix inequalities(LMIs)technique;and the sufficient conditions for the existence of the robust predictive control are given.The feasibility of the optimization problems guarantees that the closed-loop singular time-delay systems are robustly stable,and the regularity and the impulse-free property of singular systems are also held.A simulation example illustrates the efficiency of this method.

authors.name: LIU Xiao-hua
authors.org: College of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Yantai Shandong ,China

authors.name: WANG Li-jie
authors.org: College of Mathematics and Information,Ludong University,Yantai Shandong ,China

MxtDJ7ar.title: Stability Analysis of a Simplified DMC Algorithm
MxtDJ7ar.abstract: The stability problem of the simplified DMC algorithm is analyzed in the structure of internal model control and the stability condition of the closed-loop systems is obtained in the presence of incorrect model.The simulation results testify the correctness and effectiveness of the proposed method.

IhfTUrSu.title: Fault-tolerant control of delayed uncertain systems with sensor faults using RMPC
IhfTUrSu.abstract: The problem of fault-tolerant controller design for a class of delayed uncertain systems with sensor faults is studied in this paper. It is shown that a solution for this problem can be obtained from robust model predictive control(RMPC). The sensor faults are presented as a more general and practical descrete fault model. Based on the linear matrix inequality method, sufficient conditions for the existence of RMPC fault-tolerant controller are given for the system. An iterative algorithm is developed to inhance performance of the control procedure. Simulation example shows the effectiveness of the controller. © 2011 Chinese Assoc of Automati.
IhfTUrSu.venue: Proceedings of the 30th Chinese Control Conference, CCC 2011

0Y6pnNeq.title: Robust Predictive Control for A Class of Uncertain Systems Based on State Observer
0Y6pnNeq.abstract: The problem of robust predictive control for the systems with norm-bounded uncertainties is studied using the method of linear matrix inequality.With the predicted status value at every sampling time,the infinite time domain "min-max" optimization problems are converted into convex optimization ones,the state feedback control law is deduced.In order to guarantee the stability of the closed-loop system simultaneously,the state observer is designed when the control law satisfying the observer gain LP.The simulation example testify the correctness and effectiveness of this method.

authors.name: YANG Yuan-hua
authors.org: School of Control Science and Engineering,Shangdong University,Jinan ,China

upsWkU5N.title: Emulator-based DGPC with state feedback
upsWkU5N.abstract: For sampled dynamic systems, the delta operator is an attractive alternative to the shift operator. Knowing that at rapid sampling rates, system using the delta operator shows better numerical properties and a closer rapprochement to the continuous-time description. In the paper, emulator-based DGPC (delta-operator generalized predictive control) with state feedback is proposed. The state space form of emulator based DGPC is discussed and the state feedback one step ahead predictive control are adopted, the paper presents the controller with output prediction feedback and state feedback for fast sampled adaptive control systems. The structure of state feedback generalized predictive control in delta domain is a dynamic state variable feedback control using the estimated state variable feedback control. Due to the established state dynamic feedback, the ability of rejection undetectable disturbance is increased. The numerical example shows the effectiveness of the proposed algorithm.
keywords: state feedback one step ahead predictive control

JgkB0pxI.title: Robust model predictive control of continuous uncertain systems.
JgkB0pxI.abstract:
The authors concern robust model predictive control for linear continuous systems with polytopic uncertainties and input constraints.
 At each sampling time, a piecewise constant control sequence is obtained by solving a set of linear matrix inequalities. The
 sufficient conditions on the existence of the model predictive control are given, and the robust stability of the closed-loop
 systems is guaranteed. A simulation example illustrates the efficiency of the proposed method.

8fwo1Erd.title: Predictive Control Algorithm Based on Optimal Information Fusion Kalman Filter
8fwo1Erd.abstract: Aiming at the linear time-invariant system under noise condition,predictive control algorithm is presented based on optimal information fusion Kalman filter.By using the optimal information fusion Kalman filter in the linear minimum variance sense,the state estimators are derived.Further more,N steps ahead output predictions are obtained.Finally,the control inputs based on information fusion state estimators are calculated by minimizing the quadratic cost.A simulation example illustrates the efficiency of this method.

pKkRFIGl.title: Decentralized Predictive Control for Interconnected Time-delay System Based on LMI
pKkRFIGl.abstract: The problem of decentralized predictive control is studied for the decentralized control models of interconnected time-delay system.The min-max optimized problem of infinite horizon quadratic objective is reduced to the convex optimization involving LMI.The complication of computation is relieved online.Meanwhile,the algorithm of the decentralized predictive control is put forward.

E9U9Qcbt.title: Output feedback robust predictive control of singular systems with structured feedback uncertainty
E9U9Qcbt.abstract: The problem of output feedback robust model predictive control was presented for the singular systems with structured feedback uncertainties described by linear fractional model when the states of control systems were immeasurable. Based on the idea of variable transformation and LMI methods, the nonlinear inequalities with output feedback controller gain matrixes are decoupled, and the infinite time domain "min-max" optimization problems are converted into convex optimization problems. The sufficient conditions for the existence of this controller were derived. It is proved that the robust stability of the closed-loop singular systems is guaranteed by the initial feasible solution of the optimization problems, and the regular and the impulse-free of singular systems are also held. A simulation example shows the effectiveness of the method.
E9U9Qcbt.venue: Zhongnan Daxue Xuebao (Ziran Kexue Ban)/Journal of Central South University (Science and Technology)

iEBt5lK0.title: Further results on adaptive state-feedback stabilization for stochastic high-order nonlinear systems
iEBt5lK0.abstract: This paper aims to relax the results in Xie and Tian (2009) from the following two aspects: completely removing the power order restriction and largely relaxing the growth conditions of nonlinear functions. By using the backstepping design method and homogeneous domination technique, this paper investigates the problem of adaptive state-feedback stabilization for a class of stochastic high-order nonlinear systems with nonlinear parameterization. The closed-loop system can be proved to be globally stable in probability and the states can be regulated to the origin almost surely. The efficiency of the adaptive state-feedback controller is demonstrated by a simulation example.
